attributes.action: Make all jobs easier to apply for!
attributes.additional_details:
If an employer advertises a job on the internet then it is very unreasonable & in fact sadistic to ask the applicants to then apply for the job they've just found on the internet...
 by phone or by post instead, when they are already on the internet & could then apply for the job instantly on the internet at no extra cost.
The unemployed in particular should not have to pay for a phone call, or an envelope, or a stamp, or printer ink, or paper, or have to spend valuable time & money (on bus-fares/fuel) getting to a jobcentre to access the facilities there at the unnecessary expense of the taxpayer instead: It should be a mandatory requirement that all jobs advertised on the internet can be applied for over the internet.
If employers do not want applicants to be able to apply for their vacancies over the internet then they should not be given the privilege of being allowed to advertise their vacancies on the internet.
